course_title: Introduction to Psychology: Developmental, Social & Clinical Psychology

learning_outcomes.description: Have a foundational understanding of research and theory in developmental, clinical, and social psychology, and their broad historical contexts
Engage in scientific thinking to accurately interpret and meaningfully progress research in the field
Use the language of psychology to engage in oral and written communication of research in the field
Communicate and work effectively with others from diverse backgrounds to achieve a common outcome
Become active participants in academic culture and practices at the university level
Describe Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples identities, cultures, and histories with particular focus on connection to Country, cultural resilience, and resistance to colonisation.

assessments.task_description: As a valuable adjunct to learning about research from lectures, tutorials, and texts, PSYC1030 students have the opportunity to learn first-hand through participation in actual research studies, and to earn up to six percent marks towards their course grade.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Using SONA portal as per email instructions in Week 2. Alternative research participation assessments should be submitted via the submission portal in the Blackboard Assessment -> Research Participation folder.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.weighting: <dd> P/F Required to pass the course </dd>
assessments.task_description:
Students need to complete the online cultural safety module before the end of semester and complete the short answer quiz for this on the blackboard page. Students will be automatically enrolled in the LearnX course for the whole Faculty with a link available on the PSYC1030 page.

Students must complete the online quiz via the PSYC1030 blackboard page. This quiz will have 2 short answer questions and students will be marked on whether theirs is an appropriate response, evidenced by module content and resources. Inappropriate or derogatory/disrespectful answers will fail this assessment.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission is via the online quiz on blackboard before the due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Format: There are 4 in-tutorial quizzes as set out in the lecture schedule. The quizzes are CLOSED BOOK and comprise 54 multiple choice questions with 60 minutes to complete.

Content: Each quiz will assess the previous 3 weeks of lecture and learning enrichment material.

Time & Date: Quizzes are to be completed during your weekly tutorial in quiz weeks 5, 7, 10, and 13. 

Further instructions and details will be provided in the learning enrichment sessions, tutorials, and on the Blackboard site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.assessment_title: Cycle of Science: Individual study e-Poster
assessments.task_description:
In this assignment, you will create an e-poster mapping out the 'Cycle of Science' for your study of choice. You will need to choose one scientific study from the list of studies that relate to the lecture topics covered in the course. The reference list will be provided on Blackboard. An e-poster template will also be provided on Blackboard. 

Each week in your tutorials, you will learn about the conceptual framework of the 'Cycle of Science', starting in Week 1. You will also have opportunities to complete in-class activities which are designed to help you learn how to map out the cycle and get practice in it. TUTORIAL ATTENDANCE IS ESSENTIAL FOR SUCCESS ON THIS ASSIGNMENT. The marking criteria sheet for this assignment will be available on the course Blackboard site and reviewed in your tutorials.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The e-poster must be created using the e-poster template provided on Blackboard. To submit your assignment electronically log in to http://learn.uq.edu.au with your UQ username and password, then click on PSYC1030>>Assessment>>Assignment submission portals, and then use the appropriate assignment submission link for each piece of assessment. No e-mailed submissions will be accepted. Full instructions on how to submit your assignment through Turnitin can be found under 'Assessments' on Blackboard. You will be required to keep evidence that your assignment has been submitted by downloading the digital receipt confirming submission provided in the TurnitIn Assignment Dashboard. NOTE: You will no longer receive an automatic submission receipt from Turnitin confirming your assignment has been received. Failure to provide proof of submission may result in your assignment not being accepted. No extensions will be provided for this assignment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Each week in tutorials, you will learn how to design a scientific study based on existing research. You will apply these critical thinking skills to complete the group project, in which you and your group members will develop an original scientific study. This assignment involves writing up the Introduction and References section of a scientific report of the study that you develop with your group. In the week 11 tutorials and Learning Enrichment session, you will be guided through the process of how to structure and write Introduction and Reference sections, critically review relevant literature, and introduce the study and hypotheses.

Tutorial attendance is vital to ensure you have the information and skills required to write this assignment. 

Tutorials in weeks 6, 8 and 9 are group work tutorials in which you design a study and develop a Cycle of Science poster for your new study. This new study is the study that your assignment 2 (Introduction) will be based on so it is very important that you attend these tutorials and contribute to the study design.

When writing this assignment, you must use APA 7th format. There is a strict 1,000 word limit for this assignment (no 10% buffer) and tutor will stop reading from this point onwards. The word count does not include the title page, title heading, and References section; however, in-text references do count toward the word limit. 

A reasonable attempt at this assessment that addresses the marking criteria is REQUIRED in order to pass the course.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The report must be word-processed using 12 pt font and minimum 2 cm margins. Use double line spacing. You must submit your Introduction electronically. To submit your assignment electronically log in to http://learn.uq.edu.au with your UQ username and password, then click on PSYC1030>>Assessment>>Assignment submission portal, and then use the appropriate assignment submission link for each piece of assessment. No e-mailed submissions will be accepted. Full instructions on how to submit your assignment through Turnitin can be found under 'Assessments' on Blackboard. You will be required to keep evidence that your assignment has been submitted by downloading a copy of the digital receipt confirming submission on the Turnitin Assignment Dashboard. Failure to provide proof of submission may result in your assignment not being accepted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
